p: Mann-Whitney and Friedman tests were used to compare the mean scores of the symptoms in the EA and the placebo groups according to the PSST before and after the first and the second cycles of the intervention. However, normality is not an essential assumption for Generalized Estimating Equation (GEE). Marginal modeling within GEE is considered as a powerful tool to analyze non-normally distributed data [ 40]. Therefore, GEE was used to compare the total scores of the intensity of PMS between the two study groups before and after the first and the second cycles of the intervention.
